issues.description: Constructor parameter order for Meal is inconsistent between the problem statement / solution and the template. The UML in the problem and the solution implementation expect Meal(String name, String[] ingredients), but the template's Meal class declares the constructor as Meal(String[] ingredients, String name). The template Main also uses the name-first constructor (Meal("cowBoyStew", new String[]{...})), which will not compile with the template Meal signature. This mismatch will confuse students and can prevent the provided example Main (and any tests expecting name-first) from compiling or working correctly.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the template Meal constructor signature to match the problem statement and solution: public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients). Update the parameter order in the template Meal.java accordingly so the example Main and student code compile and align with the UML and reference solution.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and examples) specifies a Meal constructor with signature Meal(String, String[]) — i.e., name first, ingredients second — and the commented Main examples call new Meal("cowBoyStew", new String[]{...}). The template implementation, however, declares the constructor as Meal(String[] ingredients, String name) (ingredients first, name second). This mismatch between the documented/expected constructor signature and the template implementation creates a direct mapping/confusion for students and will cause the provided example calls to not compile against the template. The solution repository uses the constructor ordering that matches the problem statement (name first).
issues.suggested_fix: Align the template with the problem statement and solution by changing the Meal constructor in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Meal.java to public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients) (name first, ingredients second). Alternatively, update the problem examples and commented Main calls to match the template constructor ordering, but the clearer fix is to make the template constructor match the UML and solution.
